verses.verse: For by fire and by (Is. 27:1) His sword The LORD will judge all flesh; And the slain of the LORD shall be (Is. 34:6) many.

“Those (Is. 65:3-8) who sanctify themselves and purify themselves, To go to the gardens After an idol in the midst, Eating swine’s flesh and the abomination and the mouse, Shall be consumed together,” says the LORD.
“For I know their works and their (Is. 59:7) thoughts. It shall be that I will (Is. 45:22-25; Jer. 3:17) gather all nations and tongues; and they shall come and see My glory.

(Luke 2:34) I will set a sign among them; and those among them who escape I will send to the nations: to Tarshish and Pul and Lud, who draw the bow, and Tubal and Javan, to the coastlands afar off who have not heard My fame nor seen My glory. (Mal. 1:11) And they shall declare My glory among the Gentiles.

Then they shall (Is. 49:22) bring all your brethren (Is. 18:7; (Rom. 15:16)) for an offering to the LORD out of all nations, on horses and in chariots and in litters, on mules and on camels, to My holy mountain Jerusalem,” says the LORD, “as the children of Israel bring an offering in a clean vessel into the house of the LORD.
And I will also take some of them for (Ex. 19:6; Is. 61:6; 1 Pet. 2:9; Rev. 1:6) priests and Levites,” says the LORD.

“For as (Is. 65:17; Heb. 12:26, 27; 2 Pet. 3:13; Rev. 21:1) the new heavens and the new earth Which I will make shall remain before Me,” says the LORD, “So shall your descendants and your name remain.
And (Zech. 14:16) it shall come to pass That from one New Moon to another, And from one Sabbath to another, (Zech. 14:17-21) All flesh shall come to worship before Me,” says the LORD.

“And they shall go forth and look Upon the corpses of the men Who have transgressed against Me. For their (Is. 14:11; Mark 9:44, 46, 48) worm does not die, And their fire is not quenched. They shall be an abhorrence to all flesh.”
The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were (Josh. 21:18; 1 Kin. 2:26; 1 Chr. 6:60; Is. 10:30; Jer. 29:27) in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin,
to whom the word of the LORD came in the days of (1 Kin. 13:2; 2 Kin. 21:24; 2 Chr. 34:1; Jer. 3:6; 36:2) Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, (Jer. 25:3) in the thirteenth year of his reign.

It came also in the days of (2 Kin. 23:34; 1 Chr. 3:15; 2 Chr. 36:5-8; Jer. 25:1) Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, (2 Kin. 24:17; 1 Chr. 3:15; 2 Chr. 36:11-13; Jer. 39:2) until the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah the son of Josiah, king of Judah, (Jer. 52:12) until the carrying away of Jerusalem captive (2 Kin. 25:8) in the fifth month.
The Prophet Is Called Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
“Before I (Is. 49:1, 5) formed you in the womb (Ex. 33:12) I knew you; Before you were born I ((Luke 1:15); Gal. 1:15) sanctified you; I ordained you a prophet to the nations.”
Then said I: (Ex. 4:10; 6:12, 30) “Ah, Lord GOD! Behold, I cannot speak, for I am a youth.”
But the LORD said to me: “Do not say, ‘I am a youth,’ For you shall go to all to whom I send you, And (Num. 22:20, 38; Jer. 1:17; Matt. 28:20) whatever I command you, you shall speak.
(Ezek. 2:6; 3:9) Do not be afraid of their faces, For (Ex. 3:12; Deut. 31:6; Josh. 1:5; Jer. 15:20; Heb. 13:6) I am with you to deliver you,” says the LORD.
Then the LORD put forth His hand and (Is. 6:7; Mark 7:33-35) touched my mouth, and the LORD said to me: “Behold, I have (Ex. 4:11-16; Deut. 18:18; Is. 51:16) put My words in your mouth.

(1 Kin. 19:17) See, I have this day set you over the nations and over the kingdoms, To (Jer. 18:7-10; Ezek. 22:18; (2 Cor. 10:4, 5)) root out and to pull down, To destroy and to throw down, To build and to plant.”
